required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: BIBW 2992 (Afatinib) and Vinorelbine in Japanese Patients With Advanced Solid Tumours
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label Phase I Study of Once Daily Oral Treatment With BIBW 2992 in Combination With Weekly Vinorelbine Intravenous Injection in Japanese Patients With Advanced Solid Tumours

brief_summary.textblock:
- To identify the Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) of afatinib in combination with vinorelbine i.v. by assessment of Dose Limiting Toxicities (DLT);
- To assess safety and anti-tumour efficacy and determine pharmacokinetic characteristics of afatinib and vinorelbine i.v.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Dose Limiting Toxicities (DLTs) During 1st Course
primary_outcome.description: DLTs and Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) of afatinib in combination with vinorelbine iv. (MTD = not determined)

primary_outcome.time_frame: during the treatment period or up to 28 days after the completion of drug administration, up to 730 days
primary_outcome.description: Number of patients with drug-related adverse events

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-dose, 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 7hours, and 23hours55minutes after 7th or 14th or 21th dose (as "with Vinorelbine") and 20th dose (as "without Vinorelbine")
secondary_outcome.description: area under the plasma concentration-time curve following dose at steady state over the dosing interval τ

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-dose, 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 7hours, and 23hours55minutes after 7th or 14th or 21th dose (as "with Vinorelbine") and 20th dose (as "without Vinorelbine")
secondary_outcome.description: maximum measured plasma concentration at steady state

secondary_outcome.time_frame: predose, 10minutes, 0.5, 1, 4, 7 hours, 23hours55minutes after 2nd or 3rd or 4th dose (as "with afatinib") and 1st dose (as "without afatinib")
secondary_outcome.description: area under the blood concentration-time curve of the analyte over the time interval from 0 extrapolated to infinity

secondary_outcome.time_frame: predose, 10minutes, 0.5, 1, 4, 7 hours, 23hours55minutes after 2nd or 3rd or 4th dose (as "with afatinib") and 1st dose (as "without afatinib")
Pre-treatment, every 8 weeks after start of study treatment, end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: According to Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) 1.1 criteria and assessed by CT or MRI: Complete Response (CR), disappearance of all target and non-target lesions; Partial Response (PR), at least a 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions; Overall Response (OR) = CR + PR."

arm_group.description: patient to receive 20mg or 40mg of po daily afatinib in combination with vinorelbine IV

intervention.description: patient to receive afatinib low dose po daily in combination with vinorelbine iv
patient to receive afatinib high dose po daily in combination with vinorelbine iv
patient to receive standard dose vinorelbine once a week for four times per cycle

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Histologically confirmed diagnosis of malignancy that is advanced and for which standard therapies do not exist or are no longer effective.
- Life expectancy at least 12 weeks
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Performance Status 0 or 1
- Adequate hepatic, renal, haematologic and other organ function
- Written informed consent
Exclusion criteria:
- Chemotherapy, immunotherapy, surgery and radiotherapy within the past 4 weeks
- Prior treatment with afatinib and or vinorelbine
- Clinically significant active infectious disease

group.title: Afatinib 20 mg With Vinorelbine 25 mg/m^2 (Cohort 1)
group.description: Afatinib 20 mg oral administration once a day with vinorelbine 25 mg/m^2 intravenous injection weekly

group.title: Afatinib 40 mg With Vinorelbine 25 mg/m^2 (Cohort 2)
group.description: Afatinib 40 mg oral administration once a day with vinorelbine 25 mg/m^2 intravenous injection weekly

group.title: Afatinib 40 mg With Vinorelbine 20 mg/m^2 (Cohort 2a)
group.description: Afatinib 40 mg oral administration once a day with vinorelbine 20 mg/m^2 intravenous injection weekly

group.title: Afatinib 40 mg With Vinorelbine 25 mg/m^2 (Cohort 3)
group.description: Afatinib 40 mg oral administration once a day with vinorelbine 25 mg/m^2 intravenous injection weekly; allowed for vinorelbine dose to be skipped for Common Toxicity Criteria for Adverse Effects (CTCAE) Grade 2 or worse neutropenia or thrombocytopenia

participants_list.participants: Cohort 3 with afatinib/vinorelbine modification. Skipping vinorelbine allowed and not considered DLT

outcome.title: AUCτ,ss for Afatinib
outcome.description: area under the plasma concentration-time curve following dose at steady state over the dosing interval τ
outcome.time_frame: pre-dose, 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 7hours, and 23hours55minutes after 7th or 14th or 21th dose (as “with Vinorelbine”) and 20th dose (as “without Vinorelbine”)

group.title: Afatinib 20 mg With Vinorelbine
group.description: Afatinib 20 mg oral administration once a day with vinorelbine intravenous injection weekly. All patient was assigned as “20 mg afatinib with vinorelbine 25 mg/m2” or “40 mg afatinib with vinorelbine 20 mg/m2” or “40 mg afatinib with vinorelbine 25 mg/m2”. On day 21 (after 20 doses of afatinib), 6 days passed after last vinorelbine administration (day 15) and PK parameters of afatinib on day 21 were treated as “without vinorelbine” because no large effect of vinorelbine is expected from PK point of view.

group.title: Afatinib 20 mg Without Vinorelbine
group.description: Afatinib 20 mg oral administration once a day without vinorelbine intravenous injection weekly. All patient was assigned as “20 mg afatinib with vinorelbine 25 mg/m2” or “40 mg afatinib with vinorelbine 20 mg/m2” or “40 mg afatinib with vinorelbine 25 mg/m2”. On day 21 (after 20 doses of afatinib), 6 days passed after last vinorelbine administration (day 15) and PK parameters of afatinib on day 21 were treated as “without vinorelbine” because no large effect of vinorelbine is expected from PK point of view.

outcome.title: AUC0-∞ for Vinorelbine
outcome.description: area under the blood concentration-time curve of the analyte over the time interval from 0 extrapolated to infinity

group.title: Vinorelbine 20 mg/m^2 With Afatinib
group.description: Vinorelbine 20 mg/m^2 intravenous injection weekly with afatinib oral administration once a day. All patient was assigned as “20 mg afatinib with vinorelbine 25 mg/m2” or “40 mg afatinib with vinorelbine 20 mg/m2” or “40 mg afatinib with vinorelbine 25 mg/m2”. On day 1, no afatinib was administered and PK parameters of vinorelbine on day 1 were treated as “without afatinib”.

outcome.title: Objective Tumour Response
outcome.description: According to Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) 1.1 criteria and assessed by CT or MRI: Complete Response (CR), disappearance of all target and non-target lesions; Partial Response (PR), at least a 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions; Overall Response (OR) = CR + PR."
outcome.time_frame: Pre-treatment, every 8 weeks after start of study treatment, end of treatment

measure.title: Objective Tumour Response
measure.description: According to Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) 1.1 criteria and assessed by CT or MRI: Complete Response (CR), disappearance of all target and non-target lesions; Partial Response (PR), at least a 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions; Overall Response (OR) = CR + PR."

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Any publication of the result of this trial must be consistent with the Boehringer Ingelheim publication policy. The rights of the investigator and of the sponsor with regard to publication of the results of this trial are described in the investigator contract.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: MTD was not determined and below Cohort 2 due to DLTs likely related to vinorelbine. After the revised dose criteria for afatinib and vinorelbine were implemented, Cohort 3 was established as a recommended dose.
